parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Loose Rear Brake Assembly to Axle Flange Retaining Spider Bolts
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Loose rear brake assembly to axle flange retaining spider bolts can cause the brake assembly to come loose, leading to reduced braking performance, increased stopping distances, and potentially causing accidents.
symptoms: as the issue is typically discovered during inspection or maintenance.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Radiator Clogging due to Engine Crankcase Breather Tube Design
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The engine crankcase breather tube design can cause debris to enter the radiator, leading to overheating, which can result in engine damage, reduced performance, and potential safety risks.

The failure of the fan hub bearings can cause the fan to detach from the pulley, leading to damage to the pulley bearing assembly, fan, and radiator, which can result in engine overheating, reduced performance, and potential safety risks.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Loose Rear Brake Assembly to Axle Flange Retaining Spider Bolts
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Loose brake assembly bolts can cause the brake system to malfunction, leading to reduced stopping power, increased stopping distances, and potentially causing accidents.
symptoms: unusual noises when applying the brakes

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Faulty Torque Rod Brackets on Chalmers Suspension System
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Faulty torque rod brackets can cause the suspension system to malfunction, leading to reduced vehicle stability, uneven tire wear, and potentially causing accidents.
